poem:
**The Sound of Dawn in Gaza**

In the morning fog of Cairo,
a polio whisper rides the wind,
paralyzing not just a child, 
but the very breath of hope—
while negotiators circle,
drawing lines in desert sand,
the stars above still shimmer,
untouched by borders,
unchanged by sorrow.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Israel-Gaza war live: Israeli negotiators in Cairo for ceasefire and hostage talks as Kamala Harris urges peace 10.58am BST Baby paralysed in first polio case in Gaza in 25 years Philippe Lazzarini, commissioner-general of the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees, is reporting that a 10-month-old baby in Gaza was paralysed by polio. The polio virus was detected last month in waste water samples in Deir al-Baleh and Khan Younis. The 10-month-old". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
